en.BlobTrigger_description: A function that will be run whenever a blob is added to a specified container
en.CSharp_description: A C# function that will be run whenever it receives a GitHub webhook request
en.EmptyBash_description: An empty Bash function without triggers, inputs, or outputs
en.EmptyBatch_description: An empty Batch function without triggers, inputs, or outputs
en.EmptyCSharp_description: An empty C# function without triggers, inputs, or outputs
en.EmptyFSharp_description: An empty F# function without triggers, inputs, or outputs
en.EmptyNodeJS_description: An empty JavaScript function without triggers, inputs, or outputs
en.EmptyPHP_description: An empty PHP function without triggers, inputs, or outputs
en.EmptyPowerShell_description: An empty PowerShell function without triggers, inputs, or outputs
en.EmptyPython_description: An empty Python function without triggers, inputs, or outputs
en.EventHubTrigger_description: A function that will be run whenever an event hub receives a new event
en.FaceLocator_description: A function that processes images and outputs the bounding rectangle of faces using Cognitive Services
en.GenericWebhook_description: A function that will be run whenever it receives a webhook
en.GitHubCommenter_description: A function that will be run whenever it receives a GitHub webhook for an issue or pull request and adds a comment
en.GithubWebhook_description: A function that willl be run whenever it receives a GitHub webhook
en.HttpGETCRUD_description: A function that fetches entities from a Storage table when it receives an HTTP request
en.HttpPOSTCRUD_description: A function that adds entities to a Storage table when it receives an HTTP request
en.HttpPUTCRUD_description: A function that updates entity in a Storage table when it receives an HTTP request
en.HttpTrigger_description: A function that will be run whenever it receives an HTTP request, responding based on data in the body or query string
en.ImageResizer_description: A function that creates resized images whenever a blob is added to a specified container
en.ManualTrigger_description: A function that is triggered manually via the portal "Run" button
en.QueueTrigger_description: A function that will be run whenever a message is added to a specified Azure Storage queue
en.SaasFileTrigger_description: A function that will be run whenever a file is added to an external file store
en.SaasTable_description: A function that will be run whenever data is added to an external table store
en.SasToken_description: A function that generates a SAS token for a given Azure Storage container and blob name
en.SendGrid_description: A function that sends a confirmation e-mail when a new item is added to a particular queue
en.ServiceBusQueueTrigger_description: A function that will be run whenever a message is added to a specficied Service Bus queue
en.ServiceBusTopicTrigger_description: A function that will be run whenever a message is added to the specified Service Bus Topic
en.TimerTrigger_description: A function that will be run on a specified schedule
en.TimerTriggerExcelOutlook_description: Read two Excel tables, send emails based on the data, and then update an Excel table.
en.timerTrigger_schedule_errorText: Invalid Cron Expression. Please consult the documentation to learn more.

en.Identity_help:
UserFromRequest: Same as UserFromToken with the user token taken from the X-MS-TOKEN-AAD-ID-TOKEN header. Only works for HttpTrigger
UserFromToken: Obtains the access token on behalf of the user whose token is in the userToken field of metadata. 
UserFromId: Obtains the access token for the user with the id found in the userId field of metadata.
ClientCredentials: Obtains the access token for the client credentials found in the application settings.
en.userid_help: The user ID of a user who has previously logged into the app.
en.usertoken_help: A token with the function app as the audience.

en.tryLanding_functionError: Function creation error! Please try again.
en.tryLanding_ifYou: If you'd prefer another supported language, you can choose one later in the functions portal.
en.integrate_inputsHelp: Input bindings provide additional data provided to your function when it is triggered. For instance, you can fetch data from table storage on a new queue message. Inputs are optional.
en.integrate_outputsHelp: Outputs bindings allow you to output data from your function. For instance, you can add a new item to a queue. Outputs are optional.
en.integrate_triggersHelp: Triggers are what will start your function. For instance, you can trigger on a new queue message. You must always have a trigger.
en.binding_createNewFunction: Create a new function triggered by this output
en.fileExplorer_changesLost: Changes made to current file will be lost. Are you sure you want to continue?
en.fileExplorer_deletePromt: Are you sure you want to delete {{fileName}}
en.fileExplorer_editingBinary: Editing binary files is not supported.
en.tutorial_theFastestWayCSharp: The fastest way to edit code is with the code editor, but you can also use Git.This example uses C#, but many other languages are also supported.
en.tryNow_FreeAccountToolTip: Signing up for a free Azure account unlocks all Functions capabilities without worrying about time limits!
en.error_CORSNotConfigured: CORS is not configured for this function app. Please add {{origin}} to your CORS list.

en.error_siteStopped: Your function app is stopped. You cannot use the functions portal when the app is stopped. You can change that by going to the function app settings view on the left side bar and then going to the app service settings blade.
en.error_NoPermissionToAccessApp: You don't have sufficient permissions to access this function app. You may still be able to see basic settings in the app service settings blade which you can access from the function app settings link on the left sidebar.

en.featureNotSupportedForSlots: This feature is not supported for slots
en.featureNotSupportedForLinuxApps: This feature is not supported for Linux apps

en.feature_deploymentSourceInfo: Configure and manage deployment options for your app, including continuous deployment from VSTS, Github and Bitbucket as well as trigger deployments from OneDrive, Dropbox, external Git and more.
en.feature_deploymentCredsInfo: Configure Azure account-level deployment credentials. To change your app-level credentials (also known as 'Publish Credentials'), choose 'Reset publish credentials' in the 'Overview' tab. Learn more.
en.feature_consoleInfo: Explore your app's file system from an interactive web-based console.
en.feature_sshInfo: SSH provides a Web SSH console experience for your Linux app code
en.feature_extensionsInfo: Extensions add functionality to your entire app.
en.emptyVirtualDirectories: (no virtual applications or directories to display)
en.feature_applicationSettingsInfo: Manage app settings, connection strings, runtime settings, and more.
en.configRequiresWritePermissionOnApp: You must have write permissions on the current app in order to edit these settings.
en.configDisabledReadOnlyLockOnApp: This app has a read-only lock that prevents editing settings or retrieving secure data. Please remove the lock and try again.
en.configUpdateFailure: Failed to update web app settings:
en.netFrameWorkVersionLabelHelp: The version used to run your web app if using the .NET Framework
en.phpVersionLabelHelp: The version used to run your web app if using PHP
en.pythonVersionLabelHelp: The version used to run your web app if using Python
en.pythonInfoText: App Service supports installing newer versions of Python. Click here to learn more.
en.javaVersionLabelHelp: The version used to run your web app if using Java
en.javaMinorVersionLabelHelp: Select the desired Java minor version. Selecting 'Newest' will keep your app using the JVM most recently added to the portal.
en.javaWebContainerLabelHelp: The web container version used to run your web app if using Java
en.use32BitWorkerProcessLabelHelp: The platform architecture your web app runs
en.use32BitWorkerProcessUpsell: 64-bit configuration requires a basic or higher App Service plan
en.webSocketsEnabledLabelHelp: WebSockets allow more flexible connectivity between web apps and modern browsers.  Your web app would need to be built to leverage these capabilities.
en.alwaysOnLabelHelp: Indicates that your web app needs to be loaded at all times. By default, web apps are unloaded after they have been idle. It is recommended that you enable this option when you have continuous web jobs running on the web app.
en.alwaysOnUpsell: Always on requires a basic or higher App Service plan
en.autoSwapNotSupportedFromProd: Auto swap destinations cannot be configured from production slot
en.autoSwapUpsell: Auto Swap requires a standard or higher App Service Plan
en.clientAffinityInfoText: You can improve the performance of your stateless applications by turning off the Affinity Cookie, stateful applications should keep the Affinity Cookie turned on for increased compatibility. Click to learn more.
en.linuxFxVersionLabelHelp: Web Apps on Linux provide run-time options through a collection of built in containers. Learn more.
en.appCommandLineLabelHelp: Provide an optional startup command that will be run as part of container startup. Learn more.
en.feature_backupsInfo: Use Backup and Restore to easily create automatic or manual backups.
en.feature_functionSettingsInfo: Manage settings that affect the Functions runtime for all functions within your app.
en.feature_networkingInfo: Securely access resources through VNET Integration and Hybrid Connections.
en.feature_sslInfo: Configure SSL bindings for your app using either a certificate you purchased externally or an App Service Certificate.
en.feature_customDomainsInfo: Configure and purchase custom domain names.
en.feature_authInfo: Use Authentication / Authorization to protect your application and work with per-user data.
en.feature_msiInfo: Your application can communicate with other Azure services as itself using a managed Azure Active Directory identity.
en.feature_pushNotificationsInfo: Send fast, scalable, and cross-platform mobile push notifications using Notification Hubs.
en.feature_diagnosticLogsInfo: Configure where and when to log application and server events.
en.feature_processExplorerInfo: View details on application processes, memory usage, and CPU utilization.
en.feature_securityScanningInfo: Enable security scanning for your app with Tinfoil Security.
en.feature_corsInfo: Configure Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) rules for your app.
en.feature_apiDefinitionInfo: Configure the location of the Swagger 2.0 metadata describing your API. This makes it easy for others to discover and consume your API.
en.feature_appServicePlanInfo: An App Service plan is the container for your app. The App Service plan settings will determine the location, features, cost and compute resources associated with your app.
en.feature_activityLogInfo: View management operations that have been performed on your app.
en.feature_accessControlInfo: Configure Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) for your app.
en.feature_tagsInfo: Tags are key/value pairs that enable you to categorize resources and view consolidated billing by applying the same tag to multiple resources and resource groups.
en.feature_locksInfo: Lock resources to prevent unexpected changes or deletions.
en.feature_automationScriptInfo: Automate deploying resources with Azure Resource Manager templates in a single, coordinated operation. Define resources and configurable input parameters and deploy with script or code.
en.feature_advancedToolsInfo: Use Kudu to inspect environment variables, access the debug console, upload zips, view processes, and more.
en.feature_appServiceEditorInfo: App Service Editor provides an in-browser editing experience for your code.
en.feature_resourceExplorerInfo: Explore management APIs with Azure Resource Explorer (preview).
en.try_appDisabled: Managing your Function app is not available for this trial.
en.backend_error_CannotAccessFunctionApp: We are not able to access your Azure settings for your function app.
en.backend_error_CannotAccessFunctionApp_ac: First make sure you have proper access to the Azure resource {0}. If you dotTry refreshing the portal to renew your authentication token.
en.backend_error_InvalidStorageConnectionSt: Please check the storage account connection string in application settings as it appears to be invalid.
Update the app setting with a valid storage connection string.
en.backend_error_MissingAzureFilesConnectio: '{0}' application setting is missing from your app. This setting contains a connection string for an Azure Storage account that is used to host your functions content. Your app will be completely broken without this setting. You may need to delete and recreate this function app if you no longer have access to the value of that application setting.
en.backend_error_MissingAzureFilesContentSh: '{0}' application setting is missing from your app. This setting contains a share name where your function content lives. Your app will be completely broken without this setting. You may need to delete and recreate this function app if you no longer have access to the value of that application setting.
en.backend_error_MissingAzureWebJobsDashboa: '{0}' application setting is missing from your app. This setting contains a connection string for an Azure Storage account that is needed for the monitoring view of your functions. This is where invocation data is aggregated and then displayed in monitoring view. Your monitoring view might be broken.
en.backend_error_MissingAzureWebJobsStorage: '{0}' application setting is missing from your app. This setting contains a connection string for an Azure Storage account that is needed for the functions runtime to handle multiple instances synchronization, log invocation results, and other infrastructure jobs. Your function app will not work correctly without that setting.
Create the app setting with a valid storage connection string.
en.backend_error_MissingFunctionsExtensionV: '{0}' application setting is missing from your app. Without this setting you'll always be running the latest version of the runtime even across major version updates which might contain breaking changes. It's advised to set that value to the current latest major version (~1) and you'll get notified with newer versions for update.
en.backend_error_StorageAccountConnectionSt: Azure Storage Account connection string stored in '{0}' is null or empty. This is required to have your function app working.
Update the app setting with a valid storage connection string.
en.backend_error_StorageAccountDoesNotExist: Storage account {0} doesn't exist. Deleting the storage account the function app is using will cause the function app to stop working.
Update the app setting with a valid existing storage connection string.
en.backend_error_StorageAccountDoesntSuppor: Storage account {0} doesn't support Azure Queues Storage. Functions runtime require queues to work properly. You'll have to delete and recreate your function app with a storage account that supports Azure Queues Storage.
en.backend_error_UnexpectedArmError: There seem to be a problem querying Azure backend for your function app.
en.backend_error_UnknownErrorWhileCallingAr: There seem to be a problem querying Azure backend for your function app.
en.error_shareCodeWithSupport: If the problem persists, contact support with the following code {{code}}

en.error_unableToDecryptKeys: We are unable to decrypt your function access keys. en.error_unableToDeleteFunctionKey: We are not able to delete the key {{keyName}} for function {{functionName}}. This can happen if the runtime is not able to load your function. Check other function errors.
en.error_unableToRenewFunctionKey: We are not able to renew the key {{keyName}} for function {{functionName}}. This can happen if the runtime is not able to load your function. Check other function errors.

en.swaggerDefinition_exporthelp: Use your API definition to access your Functions from within PowerApps and Flow.
en.swaggerDefinition_generateHelp: Create a sparse definition with the metadata from your HTTP triggered functions. Fill in the operation objects, and other information about your API before use.
en.swaggerDefinition_keyHelp:
This key secures your API Definition from access to anyone without the key.
It does not secure the underlying API. See each Function to see their key security.
en.swaggerDefinition_sourceHelp:
Set toâ€¯"Function" to enable a hosted API definition and template definition generation.
Set to "External URL" to use an API definition that is hosted elsewhere.

en.emptyBrowse: Azure Functions are an event-based serverless compute experience to accelerate your development. Scale based on demand and pay only for the resources you consume.

en.slotCreateOperationInProgressWarning: A slot create operation is currently in progress. After navigating away, you will no longer be able to check operation status.
en.slotNew_desc: Deployment slots let you deploy different versions of your function app to different URLs. You can test a certain version and then swap content and configuration between slots.
en.error_unableToLoadSlotsList: Unable to upate the list of slots
en.slotNew_quotaReached: You have reached the slots quota limit ({{quota}}) for the current plan.
en.slotNew_noAccess: No access to create a slot. Please ensure you have the right RBAC access for the function app and do not have read locks enabled either.
en.slots_upgrade: Upgrade to a standard or premium plan to add slots.
en.slots_description: Deployment slots are live apps with their own hostnames. App content and configurations elements can be swapped between two deployment slots, including the production slot.
en.slotsList_noSlots: You haven't added any deployment slots. Click 'Add Slot' to get started.
en.monitoring_appInsights: For a richer monitoring experience, including live metrics and custom queries, enable Application Insights for your Function app
en.slotNew_nameLabel_balloonText: This value will be appended to your main web app's URL and will serve as the public address of the slot.  For example if you have a web app named 'contoso' and a slot named â€˜stagingâ€™ then the new slot will have a URL like â€˜http://contoso-staging.azurewebsites.netâ€™.
en.slotNew_dynamicQuotaReached: Consumption plan allows only for a single slot. If you need more than one slot, please use dedicated App Service plans.
en.functionService_clientCertEnabled: A client certificate is required to call run this function. To run it from the portal you have to disable client certificate.

en.functionAppSettings_dailyUsageQuotaHelp: On a Consumption plan, you can limit platform usage by setting a daily usage quota, in gigabytes-seconds. Once the daily usage quota is reached, the Function App is stopped until the next day at 0:00 AM UTC.

en.downloadFunctionAppContent_includeAppSet: Include app settings in the download

This will include a file called local.settings.json which will contain your app settings values. This file will not be encrypted on download, but can be encrypted using the Azure Functions Core Tools command line.
